description: Intrinsic 8-palindromes: n is an intrinsic k-palindrome if it is a k-digit palindrome in some base.
comments: All numbers are intrinsic 1- and 2-palindromes, almost all numbers are intrinsic 3-palindromes and very few numbers are intrinsic k-palindromes for k >= 4.
links: Peter Kagey, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
A. J. Di Scala and M. Sombra, Intrinsic Palindromic Numbers, arXiv:math/0105022 [math.GM], 2001.
A. J. Di Scala and M. Sombra, Intrinsic Palindromes, Fib. Quart. 42, no. 1, Feb. 2004, pp. 76-81.
author: _Harvey P. Dale_, May 05 2001
